tripreview.Title: "Nature's beauty."
tripreview.sentence: It's a pretty good site to visit during normal vacation.
The views on offer on the way to the national park is something close to fabulous.
Plus the trekking you have to do will really get you recharged.
A must recommend.

tripreview.Title: "Visit only if u want to see goats. "
tripreview.sentence: Rating 2 is only for scenic There were no animals to visit.
But scenic was very good to see.
We stayed only 1hr and we could nt make it more because nothing more than that.
If u really have patience then you can walk more distance for watching much more goats.

tripreview.Title: "Not much as name suggest a lot of animal but its actually not."
tripreview.sentence: Giving two star for scenic beauty other wise this place literally a joke in the name of national park.
we expect more animal to see but you could get samba and wild goat only.
apart from this you can capture a lot of mesmerizing snaps of valley and black rocks few natural showers.
if you going there thinking a national park then it could proved out to be joke of the day but yes for nature lover can explore more and more view to capture in his camera.
entry ticket is 100 per head for Indian and for foreigner 350 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "walking with the clouds"
tripreview.sentence: This is so beautiful, we preservered our tickets in the morning so as to avoid standing in long queues and everyone suggested to prereserve tickets as the queues do get very long.
It was an awesome experience walking on top of the mountain with wild goats roaming.
A beautiful scenic place, lots of clouds feels awesome.

tripreview.Title: "Eravikulam National Park- a den of Nilgiri Tahr."
tripreview.sentence: This year( 30.01.15) we had been at Munnar ( 5000-8000) ft, the must go tourist spot in Kerala, is ready to welcome the tourists with its so many attractions like the hills covered with tea bushes to soothe your eyes, the lakes, the three rivers, the dams, the waterfalls, the Rajamala National Park, a natural habitat of endangered Nilgiri Tahr, a species of mountain goat, the highest mountain peak of the south, Anamudi (2695mt), and what not.
we reached Munnar at noon and transferred to our pre-booked resort, JJ Cottage , near old bus stand.
We refreshed ourselves quickly and went for food and we took lunch late in SN restaurant near our hotel.
Our next step was to book two seats for the sight seeing tours conducted by the DTPC, Munnar at their office near old bus stand for the next day morning 10am to 6pm.
They arrange 3 tours like i) Tea Valley Tour-10am-6pm,(ii) Sandal Valley Tour-9am to 6pm (iii) Village Sight Seeing Tour-9.30am to 6pm .
The tour starts from the DTPC office gate.
Contact-DTPC Information Counter, Munnar.
Mail id is keralatourismmunnardtpc@gmail.com .
The tour costs Rs 400/ per head.
Next morning our bus started at 10am, it is a 13 seater bus; most of the co tourists were foreigner.
In the 1st half we visited Mattupetty lake/ dam (14km), Echo Point (15km) Kundala lake (23km).
There you can avail boat ride, horse ride by the lake side.
After lunch we reached the last item of the day, ie, Rajamala national park.
It is 15km from the tourist centre and it is on the hills.
You have to stand in a Queue and obtain entry pass for Rs 102/ per head.
After collecting your ticket you will get on a bus which will reach you at the park gate.
The ticket should be preserved carefully as you are to return with this ticket.
A road has passed through the park and there are flower plants of various types with the sticker describing the name, botanic name etc on both the sides.
The view from this area is exciting.
Here you can see the Neelakurunji flower blooms once in 12 years.
It is told that the flower will bloom next in Dec, 2018.
The hill side view is amazing with the blue of the flower.
The most spectacular thing is the Nilgiri Tahr, endangered species, only seen at this area.
If your luck favours , you will observe them grazing on the hill side with their kids.
As the breeding time January, the park remains closed in Februaryand March.
Please do not touch them, nor feed them.
It is strictly prohibited.
The road stretches ahead and ends to a point and tourists are not allowed to move further.
Here one can trek to the highest peak, Anamudi, with permission.
There is sitting arrangements under the thatched umbrella.
From this point the beauty of the hills with tea plantations, grass lands and the shoals, rare flora and fauna.
Tips- Check if the park is open or not before going there/ If you decide to go, reach early say at 9am other wise the Q is very long.
/ you are to come back in the same cab of the park authority standing in a Q/ as the altitude is very high, take woolen garments.
There is heavy wind at the altitude/ Keep mineral water with you.
Distances-Encukulam-130km/Pollachi-120km/ Coimbatore-160km/Marayoor-40km/Chinnar wild life-70km/Thekkady-110km.

tripreview.Title: "Ok place"
tripreview.sentence: The only thing you'll get to see is good view points and abundance of mountain goats.
It is not really a National Park, there's human dwelling inside, so no question of wild animals around.
Bus queue is long and there are other better view points.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful setting"
tripreview.sentence: The park has spectacular views of the valley below, but the highlight of the walk is to see endangered tahrs.
We saw a group of about eight, and then one individual close to the trail despite all the human traffic.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely goats and waterfalls"
tripreview.sentence: Expect queues here, but the drive up the hill then the walk is worth it.
You will hopefully see the rare goats up close, and the wet rock waterfalls are quite spectacular .

tripreview.Title: "Nothing great, just a type of trek!"
tripreview.sentence: Too much boasting about the park.
No animals are there.
The tahr is never seen.
Too much of walking once we reach the top and nothing to do.
Just a photogenic place.

tripreview.Title: "Must Visit"
tripreview.sentence: Located at a high point in Munnar.
Covered in magical misty and the energy of this place is beautiful.
Involves some trekking.
People will knee pains may avoid.

tripreview.Title: "Mountain trip "
tripreview.sentence: Very exciting walk to the top of the mountains after almost few kilometres from the entrance.
Love the views.
It is so beautiful to see the water runs from top of the mountains.
We drunk water from the running water coming from top of the mountains.
It entry tickets over priced.
Indians pays only 90 rupees and foreigners pay 360 rupees.

tripreview.Title: "Its a OK visit,overrated"
tripreview.sentence: Just go for the views,nothing much.
Its a walk along the peak, just you can see whole munnar beauty from here.

tripreview.Title: "A must visit when in Munnar :) Lovely Experience"
tripreview.sentence: Visited the National Park on the morning of the 9th of Dec 2015.
From the entrance, we need to buy entry tickets which are reasonably priced and buses ply every 15-20 minutes taking to the top point of the National Park.
The winding roads provide a good view of the tea plantations on both sides with lots of sightings of the "Nilgiri Tahr", which is endangered and roams quite comfortably among people in this area.
Before the bus ride to the top, please make sure you are not carrying any food items (including candy chocolates) as you may have to leave them at the entrance itself.
Once you get down from the bus, it is a 1-1.5km walk to the top (do not visit too early in the day as it could e quite misty).

You definitely do not see the full bloom of the purple flowers this time of the year (to be visited in Sept-Oct of the year for them), but walking along with the Nilgiri Tahr (please please do not touch them) and posing very close to them for photos is pretty good.

tripreview.Title: "Not recommended in cloudy Weather"
tripreview.sentence: It was raining when we visited .
You have to wait for bus ticket( 95 per person)atleast for one hour in line .
Bus takes you to the top of Eravikulam Sanctuary through zig zag roads .
After going up their was complete fog ,you can't see anything .
Theirs nothing at top.
Couples can enjoy .
Bachelor's Don't.
Again wait for one hour on top for bus

tripreview.Title: "Walk in the clouds."
tripreview.sentence: We visited this place in Dec 14.
Since this is a govt owned place there are always a 100-200 people in queue for tickets, so plan ahead.
The tickets are for entry to the sanctuary and bus.
Mini buses take you to the top of the hill and you are free to roam around at leisure.
The accessible part is only around couple of kms rest is restricted area.
Although we did not spot any animals, the walk itself was very beautiful.
Don't go with the expectations of spotting wild life , but to enjoy nature.

tripreview.Title: "Purple Hills"
tripreview.sentence: Rajamalai known for Thars but I would request you to plan your trip for 2018 September October season.
You can see all hills near will turn to Purple colour.
"Neelakurinji Flowers" all over hills and it is beautiful to see and cannot describe by words.
I witnessed it in 2006.

tripreview.Title: "Searching the goat"
tripreview.sentence: A complete BLUFF, There is nothing you find HERE no goats no animals absolutely nothing .

tripreview.Title: "nice place"
tripreview.sentence: nice place as well very much cheap ticket rate to visit by forest deptt.
only it distance 3 km to see the animal.
from the bus parking place

tripreview.Title: "Small park in a big mountain"
tripreview.sentence: First buy ticket and then board a bus which will take you through spiral hilly road and one must enjoy this ride as it is all you get here.

tripreview.Title: "Spectacular views"
tripreview.sentence: We should stand in a queue to buy tickets.
The forest department bus will drop us at the entrance of the park.
Then a km trek uphill.
Eatables are not allowed.
Nilgiri goats are the only animals you will spot here.
Views from above are breathtakingly beautiful.

tripreview.Title: "Dont go ,waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: for getting a ticket we have to wait for many hours.
also much crowded.
parking is also difficult when we went there.

tripreview.Title: ""A wildlife sanctuary for rare species""
tripreview.sentence: This is Nature Park with very different experience.
It is scenic place on the hill with variety of animals especially for Nilgiri Tahr.
The place itself is so nice that one can spend whole day here.
The arrangements made by the govt are very good to make you comfortable.

tripreview.Title: "Wastage of time"
tripreview.sentence: Dont go to this place -is my advice to fellow travellers.
First there is a long queue for tickets and one has to wait for the busses to go to the hill top.
Approx waiting time- 45 mins.
The jouney to the hill top is a beautiful one.
However even after reachin there one has to climb on foot to almost 1 km uphill.
A strict no no for senior citizens.
The only animal u ll get to see is mountain goats; not worth your time and money.
Rather there are more better places to explore in and around munnar.
Even after you are done with the national park
u have to again wait for another 45 mins for the bus to arrive to bring you to the point where u started!
u r stuck there.
Its not a national park
rather just another view point(view is nice though
not worth the wait) Avoid it!

tripreview.Title: "Not worth the money nor the time"
tripreview.sentence: This visit was not worth my while, even though we were among the lucky ones that actually saw several of the famous mountain goats.
If you go, you have to buy the ticket for the fast track entrance, which is bought down in Munnar for 50 INR per person before going up to the park, this saves you a great deal of time.

For Indian attractions it is very expensive and not very interesting, another reason not to go, 360 INR per person plus extra for a camera All the park has to offer are the goats, and you have to be lucky to see them.
The visit consists of a crazy busride up too narrow roads and then a hike 1 km up the mountain.
They sell them selves on great vistas, and they are nice , but you can get great vistas along the roadsides around Munnar for free.

tripreview.Title: "Not for Seniors"
tripreview.sentence: One hour on a normal day to get tickets for the bus and then about a km walk uphill does not seem to be worth for Seniors.
Luckily we came across a few Tahrs on the road when the bus on its trip back had to stop.
Scenic beauty, of course.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: Its a nice place.
You can see lot ofgrenieries around.
Climate was also good.

tripreview.Title: "puny goats"
tripreview.sentence: but goats are puny
what am i writing
this beautiful creature striving to come back from near extinction is a must see.
and hence the five rating.
be there at dawn or dusk to make ur costly ride worthy.
went here twice and saw the thars on both occations and took selfies with them the last time.

tripreview.Title: "Best attraction around Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: The drive up the narrow winding roads in the buses up to the top of the park is a fascinating experience in itself.
Our driver stopped to let us photograph some mountain goats grazing beside the road.
Once you reach the top you can walk at your leisure up to the peak.
Spectcular views.

tripreview.Title: "just a view point"
tripreview.sentence: visited this place with friends November last.
not a must see at item.

tripreview.Title: "Good"
tripreview.sentence: Wait is long but worth it.
During season times you can see Nilgiri tahr .
Its an endangered species.
Basically a mountain goat.

tripreview.Title: "Not worth it"
tripreview.sentence: Location of this place is good.
But it takes a lot of time to reach there.
Long queue for tickets and then using national park BUS, you will get there.
After doing so much of hard work, you will find Nilgiri deer and Langoor monkeys only.
You won't find a single bird or any other animals.

tripreview.Title: "Nice And 100% Clean"
tripreview.sentence: Really it's Beautiful National Park,, Awesome Views From The top
But the boring is we need to wait in a long queue to get in the bus
but after that

tripreview.Title: "Great treasure"
tripreview.sentence: This national park has a huge variety of animals and birds.
Could not have asked for more.
All types of reptiles too.
A worthy visit.
A must to explore beautiful creatures.

tripreview.Title: "A Beautiful destination in the lap of nature"
tripreview.sentence: It is beautiful National park situated in the lap of mind blowing nature.
The best thing is that you have to enjoy its beauty by walking in wonderful surroundings.
we could only see some Nilgiri deer and Langoor monkeys in the park but the natural beauty of this place and its landscapes were amazing.
It was a wonderful experience to walk there in drizzle.

tripreview.Title: "Pointless!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: You wait in the long queue to get in the bus, pay 100 per person as entry fee to the park and all you get to do is get a bus ride and then walk for 1km to see nothing.
Disappointing experience.

tripreview.Title: "a good place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: this place is a good place to go.
reach early to avoid huge line.
we had to wait for a long time in the queue.
u wont get any animals to see but a good view of the mountains,fog etc.
u will get to see a dear only.
the ride in the bus is good too.
i give it a 3 star .

tripreview.Title: "Stunning scenery"
tripreview.sentence: A great wildlife paradise.
You can only travel so far by vehicle then you walk the rest so a reasonable level of fitness is required.
We did spot one of the nilgiri goats but only in the very distance.
The views are simply stunning, you will need a camera.
Go as early in the days as possible to avoid the crowds of domestic tourists, particularly at the weekends.

tripreview.Title: "Visit early to avoid disappointment"
tripreview.sentence: We did not get to see this place, as we tried it at 3:30pm.
The ticket counter closes at 4:30pm, so ensure you plan it in the first half, as there is long queue.

tripreview.Title: "Misty mountain"
tripreview.sentence: When we visited this park it was engulfed by mist.
We were lucky to spot Nilgiri Tahr.
As you go up in the mountains you can feel temperature difference, it gets colder.
You can enjoy nature beauty at this spot.
If you are not nature lover then do not visit this spot.

tripreview.Title: "Dont know why it is called a national park"
tripreview.sentence: Thereis only one specie of goat that is there in the national park.
Views are great from the top though.
The bus service to reach inside the park is pathetic.
We had to wait for more than half an hour for the return journey.
Very much avoidable.

tripreview.Title: "one of the highest national park in peek .. india"
tripreview.sentence: mind blowing nature atleast one's we visit this palce
outside vehicals are not allowed into this national park
the central government organizing the buses
20 mins journey we see the nature it's a mindblowing

tripreview.Title: "beautifull view"
tripreview.sentence: don't expect any animal.
but its worth it.
its one of the main attraction of munnar.
we came here for our honey moon.
it was raining as well.
so it add more beauty to this place.

tripreview.Title: "Good scenic place but no animals"
tripreview.sentence: We were told that if it is cloudy we would be unable to get a good view.
However, even though it was not sunny it was beautiful in the clouds .
What an amazing view.
They have personal jeeps and buses to take you up to base level 2.
After that one can walk up and it is a beautiful walk albeit a bit steep (the aged if not fit may have difficulty).
However, the view from base 2 is also very good .
Did not see any animals except the wild goat but you can see lots of plants.

tripreview.Title: "Total disappointment"
tripreview.sentence: I fail to understand why is it called National Park.
The only animal you see are the wild goats.
It is quite expensive considering what one gets in return.
one could feel happy walking and enjoying the Hills and clouds,but there are many other better places in Munnar,which are more beautiful.
This place is definitely not for Sr.Citizens.

tripreview.Title: "Go early"
tripreview.sentence: Our guide got us to the park early, infant we were first off the bus which meant we could wander through it without noisy people distracting the nilgrili tea - the only pace in the world they can be seen in the wild.
Views are wonderful and its a great way to start the day
but don't walk off the paths
leeches abound!

tripreview.Title: "Its Awesome"
tripreview.sentence: Really loved walking in this place.
it was dark at 3.00 pm v were walking and clouds were passing.

tripreview.Title: "Don't go there at all.not worth it "
tripreview.sentence: Not worth going here.
Stood for almost 3 hours for a bus and it was a total waste.
All that u get to see are tree plantations which u can see down in munnar too.
Total waste of time and money.

tripreview.Title: "Nice View"
tripreview.sentence: Here we can see neelakurunji a flower which flourishes for 12 years.
View from here is awesome.
But we wont get to see much animals.
By looking the name we thought we might get to see some animals.
We need to walk for 20 minutes to reach the south india's hightest point.

tripreview.Title: "You'll find only the wild-goat"
tripreview.sentence: Go here without any expectations.
After a long wait (for over 30 min.
) in the queue we could get tickets to the much hyped Eravikulam National Park.
The park's bus dropped us at the main entrance of the park and from there we were left to walk (in-fact trek) up the mountain.
You'll find only the wild-goat and no other animal.
While the view of Munnar was fantastic and out-of-the-world as we kept on walking up the mountain we were disappointed to see nothing out there.

tripreview.Title: "The best attraction in Munnar region"
tripreview.sentence: Rajamalai is the best attraction in the Munnar region.
The views from the top of the hill is really marvelous.
We could see a lot of Nilgiri Thars there.
Rajamalai is the natural habitat of Nilgiri Thars.
Even though these are wild animals, they are so friendly with humans and comes very close to people.
Soft trekking through the paved roads is a great experience.
Don't forget to carry your camera.
You can come back with a lot of superb photos.

tripreview.Title: "Average "
tripreview.sentence: So much hype is made about the tigers elephants in this park
byt right from the moment i biarded the park bus i was skeptical as to how can tigers and elephants reside in such acute slopes !
Though the park is a good trekking point
a good walk in the nature if you are not obsessed about seeing the elephants.

tripreview.Title: "Awesome place"
tripreview.sentence: Really enjoyed the peak.
Nothing much to see.
But Calm, Silent and Serene.
I liked it so much.
One has to wait in the queue longtime to catch forest dept.
bus as private vehicles are not allowed.

tripreview.Title: "Do not miss this, Find yourself among the clouds"
tripreview.sentence: You have to travel 14kms from Munnar town to reach the park bus stand.
From here you can purchase a ticket (?
90 per adult) to the park.
On holidays there is a very long queue for the tickets, it might take upto an hour or two.
Better to reserve your tickets in advance from Munnar town.
Park bus will take you through scenic tea plantations to the park gate.
From there there is a 3-4 kms walk uphill.
The scenery is mesmerizing.
You will be in the middle of clouds, and a cool weather.
The green meadows uphill will make you want to trek those hills, but do not try that, its illegal.
You will also see pack of Tahrs grazing over the meadows, sometimes they even come on the walking area amongst the humans and they are not shy.
If you have come to Munnar, you will not want to miss the scenic beauty of this place.

tripreview.Title: "Nice location, but overcrowded"
tripreview.sentence: Its again a must visit location at Munnar, but overly crowded and if you don't book your tickets in advance (from the counter available at Munnar town) you will be in queue for more than 4 hours, at times.
From the entrance there are buses available to a top point, from there need to walk for an hour to view Nilgiri Tahrs.
Walk is awesome and chance of sighting the Tahr is high, so it will be a memorable walk!

tripreview.Title: "Good Scenic Location"
tripreview.sentence: The National Park is known for being the natural habitat for Nilgiri Thar.
I visited the location in monsoon and did not find any animals in the National Park.
After entering the Park the officers mentioned that Nilgiri Thar are not seen during monsoon hence we couldn't get the benefit of seeing any animals.

tripreview.Title: "Be mesmerized by the scenery !"
tripreview.sentence: We reached the national park at around 9:45 am and they charge 90 rs ticket per adult at the counter.
The bus then takes you at a higher ground and this route offers beautiful views of the valley.
We were also lucky to spot Nilgiri Tahrs as we walked up the hill and there a lot of spots which offer panaromic views ideal for photography.

tripreview.Title: "National Park?? - Dont go expecting to see animals"
tripreview.sentence: After reaching the national park, need to wait in the long queue to get the tickets for the bus which will take you inside the park.
The bus will take you near Anamudi peak where we need to get down and walk further 1-2 Kms up the hill after which there is a restriction.
The only animal you will find are few Nilgiri Tahrs.

The one good thing about the visit is the awesome weather and view at the top which kind of compensates for the frustration of waiting in a long queue and not finding any animals in the national park.

tripreview.Title: "Must visit when you go Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: make sure you spend minimum of 2 hours there that to post lunch.
it is wonderful scenic place.

tripreview.Title: "Why this is called National Park?"
tripreview.sentence: I wonder why this is called National Park?
We have not seen any animals,except one or two goats,one or two dogs,one or two bulls.
Even after waiting in the queue for a long time and going in the bus for some time.
after reaching the top also,no animals are seen.
The man at the counter who collects money for bus and camera never returns 2 rupees (camera fees 38 rupees).
I do not know where this huge money collected(two rupees per person)goes?
in the pockets of the people at the counter?

tripreview.Title: "Visit for the view rather than the hope to see some animals"
tripreview.sentence: There are no animals in this national park except for a couple of Tahrs.
But the view from above is breathtakingly beautiful!

tripreview.Title: "Arrogant bus staff, unfriendly forest staff, terribly managed"
tripreview.sentence: 1) We saw almost no wild animal during our trip.
That kind of makes for a terrible experience at a National Park.
2) Rude Careless Staff: You need to board the official park bus so they can take you around the national park.
We were a group of 6 people with 2 small kids.
They we bought 8 tickets (although the kids didn't need tickets, buy because we wanted the 2 kids to be seated).
They wanted to split us into 2 groups because the bus that was currently had a few but not enough seats to board all of us.
We explained patiently that we would rather wait for the next bus and have all of us board together than split up, given we have tiny children with us.
They wouldn't understand and almost got into a fist fight.
We had to threaten to call some very senior police officials in Kerala to have then back down.
I believe the name of the Officer in charge was Mr. Madhavan - a 5 foot forest ranger.
Wish you happy chatting with him.
3) The natural beauty of Munnar can be seen in some of its best angles from the Eravikulam National Park.
That aside, the trip was a disaster.
4) Try the chilli soaked pineapple slices on the way out of the National Park.
It may help you forget the rude staff and lack of wild animals.
And instead only remember the nice views of the heavenly Munnar landscape from the bus ride.

tripreview.Title: "Overall Nice Trip"
tripreview.sentence: We went there by Park Authorities bus.
No private car is not allowed there.
We saw Thar, different kinds of birds in the park.
Overall nice walk, journey.

tripreview.Title: "Very nice view...."
tripreview.sentence: Dont miss this trip
Forest Dep maintaining well
They have frequent Buses trip inside the park.
Private vehicles not allowed to the park.
Better book reservation(50/- each) in Munnar to avoid standing in a loooog queue.
Bus ticket is 90/- per head.
But its worth

tripreview.Title: "Time pass"
tripreview.sentence: We need to go in bus which is arranged by park.
The bus stop at top in park where we need to walk 1 kms and see the water fall and various plants.
Nilgiri plants and special goat which can be seen in park sometimes.
The top location is superb where we can take photos of tea garden.

tripreview.Title: "Goats.. No it's a thar!"
tripreview.sentence: These are majestic
wild goats.
Nilgiri thar sanctuary is a unique one.
The thar are almost domesticated, even if they are in the wild.
They come very close and are hardly bothered by human presence.
Definitely worth a visit if you are with small kids.
The drive up the mountain is also a good experience.

tripreview.Title: "eravikulam"
tripreview.sentence: nice scenary
but only goats can be seen
no other animals

tripreview.Title: "a bit disappointing"
tripreview.sentence: You are taken there by bus and then you can walk on a road for a short piece together with a lot of people.
No wonder you don't see many animals
The only one I spotted was kind of lost on the road and pestered by tons of Indian tourists trying to touch him in spite of warning not to.
The best thing is the information room.

tripreview.Title: "Nice View Point but Time Consuming"
tripreview.sentence: "Anamudi, 2,695 meters, the highest peak in India south of the Himalayas is inside this park.
Also Park has largest surviving population of Nilgiri tahr" (from Wiki) Reaching Rajamalai takes a lot of travel and time.
To take entry ticket and bus ride you have to go through a long queue.
It might take a hour or so.
After boarding the bus you will be taken to a peak station (15-20 minutes).
From there you can walk 1 KM towards peak.
For returning also there is big queue to board the bus.
So it might take another hour.
Overall you would be spending more than 2 hours wait and ride time inside park.
Also from Munnar to Park journey takes around 3 hours.
So after spending so much time you will spend an hour at hill and there is nothing much to see except Tahr (goat) and mountains.
I would suggest, one can skip going inside the park and just spend time near the reception area.
The Mountain and Gardens are visible and scenic from that area also.
The route to Rajamalai is scenic and there are couple of eating joints near ticket counter.
So I would recommend to enjoy the scenic ride and spend some time at park reception, take photos have tea, carrots etc.
and carry on.

tripreview.Title: "Only wild without life"
tripreview.sentence: Views are no doubt awesome, amazing with mountain ranges, waterfalls but no animals except wild goats and you can find only the old goats.
Even though we didn't see any animal but place is beautiful.
But we did see some birds on the way.
There are better places to enjoy at munnar.

tripreview.Title: "Bluish sky all around you"
tripreview.sentence: An amazing place to be in.
The view is splendid, the sky can never look better.
You don't have much to see accept for the Goat and the scenic view.
It is worth a visit for the panoramic view you get to see of the tea estates and the beautiful sky.

tripreview.Title: "no tahrs if it rains"
tripreview.sentence: A bus takes you into the park.
Then, further, it is an uphill walk of 30 minutes to get to the top where the tahrs are apparently spotted.
I would advise old people against taking this walk.
If you are enthusiastic and fit, then you can climb the mountain and enjoy the views.
The park is famous for the Neelakurinji but it was not in blossom when were there.
Carry an umbrella and water with you.

tripreview.Title: "Nothing to see"
tripreview.sentence: First buy tickets and everyone needs to stand in queues for nearly 1 hour to get tickets.
Forest department bus (only 6-7 Buses) will take you and a few others along a narrow mountain road towards the national park.
Honestly you will disappointed because this national park doesn't have any animals, There is nothing to watch except for the Nilgiri.
Waterfall on the way is really nice.
View is good from here.

tripreview.Title: "A nice place for a good view and walk."
tripreview.sentence: This place is at a great height and could see the surrounding villages too.

tripreview.Title: "View was superb but no wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: i went to here with my friend .
stucked in a huge que .
but last we got the ticket and went up .
we Was expecting a lot when we reach there .
But there was nothing even a monkey.
Waste of half a day

tripreview.Title: "Stands out as name denotes and annoyed with the long queue.."
tripreview.sentence: I have visited Eravikulam National park in August 2014.
We experienced a very long and slow moving queue to reach top of National park.
Almost 2 hrs stand in queue tested our patience with my kids and parents.
The forest dept bus will take you to gate and then you will experience a scenic trek into Rajamala National Park.
Nilgiri Tahr (goats) are only animals you will spot most likely here.
Walking in the scenic atmosphere, climbing bit steep hill with mist, drizzle - fantastic feel.
Approx 1.5 - 2 km of trekking/walk involved, top parts were restricted by Forest dept.
If you get permission from Kerala Forest dept in advance can do long trek in particular season.
We spotted many Nilgiri Tahr and many small water stream on the way.
Rajamalai stands out its own as name denotes in Malayalam/Tamil language (King of the mountain).
If you could early can avoid the long queue.
This national park is splendidly covered with lots of Neelakurinji flowers which blooms only once in 12 years.

tripreview.Title: "Enchanting Rajamalai"
tripreview.sentence: The Eravikulam National Park was my best experience in Munnar.
Its was bit rainy when i visited which made the hills more green and beauitiful.
There are buses provided by the park authority which will take us to the top of the mountain.
While the ride you can enjoy the breath taking view of the hills.
From the drop point of the bus at the top station its a 2 km walk to the top of the mountain which is worth it.
During the walk you can see wild goats of Rajamalai.
You can see small water falls from the hill tops (depends on the season).
Rajamalai is famous for the flower "Neela Kurinji" which is a blue flower which only buds and blooms once in every 12 year.
At the time while the flower blooms the hill will literally look like a purple-blue carpet spread over the entire mountain.

tripreview.Title: "Only for keen animal and nature enthusiasts"
tripreview.sentence: A fair bit of climb on the hill is involved, venture if you are an animal lover, a travel and nature enthusiasts.
We managed to see only four of these endangered Niligiri Tahrs' but absolutely worth the effort.
Reaching to the top itself is a picturesque journey as a waterfall unveils itself.

There are much better places in and around Kerala to witness nature's glory so this place may not be a site-seeing wonder none-the-less set amidst an appealing scenic landscape and with these friendly four legged creatures it's a pretty delightful experience, whilst at it, don't miss spotting some chirpy friends.

tripreview.Title: "Walk along the mountains "
tripreview.sentence: It is national park about 4 km from munnar town , to avoid long quest better reserve the ticket in munnar itself local people or guide knows that total Rs 140 /person .

From the start point they will take you in their van to the point from where you have to trek when to travel in their van you enjoy scenic rides inbetween tea estates it is about 4 km by van and from the point it is about 2to 3.
Km by walk through mountains where you can spot mountain goat or nigiri tahr and you can enjoy the views .
Better not to take old people as most of them can't walk for long .

tripreview.Title: "You wont even find the creature you are looking in the picture."
tripreview.sentence: Short description of the experience: Entry ticket = 90 per head.
Waited for 1 hour in the line to begin the journey in the buses deputed by the park itself.
30 minutes great drive in the bus to visit the park.
In the route, you will see great and un-manned tea gardens.
Awesome views.
Once you are out of the bus, they will ask you to have a ONE km walk in the area where there is no creature but some silly nature views.
After about 20-25 minutes walk, you will feel cheated and you start returning to the point where the bus de-boarded you.
Board a new PARK bus again and you are back from the point you started.
Thats it.

tripreview.Title: "Nice walk and view"
tripreview.sentence: Great walk and viewpoints along the way.
Thank goodness for the lovely breeze to cool us down.
Quite a hilly walk not suitablw for people who have difficulty walking but nice view from the location the bus drops off and even some animals there plus a small cafe.

tripreview.Title: "Top of the world"
tripreview.sentence: Hi all, Wss here in October 2nd week.
Amazing beautiful place.
The views are fantastic.
Lot of nilgiri thar could be seen walking freely.
If you have the energy you can walk up the winding road for better views and loneliness as it is less crowded further up.
Carry an umbrella with you.
A drizzle would add to the beauty.

tripreview.Title: "Kids will enjoy a lot."
tripreview.sentence: This is a must visit place in Munnar.
Kids will love it.
It's better you book ticket earlier or you must wait in the queue.
After that they will take to the park in their bus then you need to walk.
If you visit their at morning or evening you will surely get a chance to see the Nilgiri Tahr.
They are very friendly animals,kids will love them and the park.

tripreview.Title: "Must Visit place in Munnar"
tripreview.sentence: its a very good place to visit.
Even though we didn't see any animal but place is beautiful.
You have to board the bus to reach to the top.
After that you have to walk ~1km to go up.
View from top is very good.

tripreview.Title: "Scenic and yum cakes but no wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: One beautiful and must visit place around Munnar but if you are looking for Animals and rare birds then it's not for you.
Here u see layers of mountains, mist and the shop near top point where bus drops tourists serves yummy cakes of banana, carrot flavours.
Only 200 passes per day so make sure you book it in advance to avoid standing in long queues.

tripreview.Title: "My View"
tripreview.sentence: Superb climate and must watch Rjamalai atleast once.

tripreview.Title: "Trip to the top"
tripreview.sentence: The place provides great views and serene environment.
The area is filled with wild goats and you can find only the old goats.
As far as the variety, the place is pretty average.
The place can be reached by car and from the gate shuttle service bus transfers you to that place.
15 mins of walk is required.

tripreview.Title: "A walk to remeber"
tripreview.sentence: We were left at the Eravikulam museum and were free to explore the park on foot, all by ourselves.
Though we couldn't spot anything but a sambar, the walk towards the top was wonderful.

tripreview.Title: "Amazing breathtaking awesome"
tripreview.sentence: It was just amazing.
We were walking with the clouds and then above the clouds.
First we had to go on a bus(park bus only).
Then from the point we came down we had to trek.
Place was amazing with mountain ranges waterfalls animals etc.
We couldn't see any tahr animals.
But we did see some birds on the way.
Amazing place to click photos.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely place to walk and see nature!"
tripreview.sentence: This is a lovely park with excellent views of nature!
We were there on a rainy day and the mists and rain just added to the beauty of the park.
There is quite a bit of walking involved, the the paths are paved and easily conversed.

tripreview.Title: "Average"
tripreview.sentence: The place is good.
But it takes a lot of time.

tripreview.Title: "Good Treking Place"
tripreview.sentence: if you go on a rainy day you will not see any animal but the walking and the trekking part between the garden is awesome.

tripreview.Title: "Forest land, long walk and Thar (animal)"
tripreview.sentence: The entire area is a forest land on the mountain.
A long walk in great weather.
What you essentially see is 2 waterfalls and a lot of Thars which are mostly like hilly goats.

tripreview.Title: "Eravikulam National Park"
tripreview.sentence: Goats!Goats!Goats!
You realise that you travelled for 1 hour to see wild goats
OMG.
this park is meant for goats.
that too
wild ones.
The atmosphere is amazing, and the view is breathtaking.
nice place to relax and just be alone.
Few good waterfalls on the way.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent place to view the Nilgiri Thar.
Wonderful waterfalls on the way.
Mists cover the forest, if you visit during rainy season and makes the whole place look magical.

tripreview.Title: "National park"
tripreview.sentence: This park is great
u do not get to see any animals here
but the scenic beauty is amazing

tripreview.Title: "Nice place to visit"
tripreview.sentence: Good place.
Altitude is quite high.
The bus trip arranged by the park officials is good, breathtaking views on the way.
After bus trip you had to walk.
I m giving 3 stars because when we went we couldn't see any animals even after walking for a km.

tripreview.Title: "worth to see"
tripreview.sentence: one can reach here by taking kerala tourism buses which are specially operated from a near by area.
bus runs through tea garden and we can see beautiful green spots after getting dropped from bus need to walk about 2km to see animals.

tripreview.Title: "Great scenery"
tripreview.sentence: We enjoyed a brief visit to this park, which has been established to preserve the local, endemic, goat.
We visited on a Sunday and had the foresight to book our place on the bus, to take us into the park, in Munnar beforehand.
The scenery is very beautiful and we did get to see one of the goats, which seem to not be phased by the masses of people.
The area we could visit was very limited as it was just a kilometre walk each way after the bus had deposited us.
I would recommend avoiding it on holidays and Sundays, if possible.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful View...!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Very good place to see the natural beauty.
We have to wait for 2 hrs in the line to get the ticket.
Bus journey is just 10 mins but view is amazing.
Bus will drop you and then you can walk up to see wild goats.
View from top is amazing.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent view"
tripreview.sentence: It is so far the best place I had been in n around Munnar.
Weather was awesome.
Take ticket from the counter for the buses.
Their buses drops you at top drop point from there you walk all the way exploring the nature.
They wont let you carry any eatables so that you dont end up throwing plastic and papers.
We didnt find a single goat or animal but thoroughly enjoyed being there.

tripreview.Title: "Royal Rajamalai"
tripreview.sentence: Excellent nature park, one should never miss in Munnar.
A stroll to the peak allows one to have the glimpse of the rare Tahr Goat,Experience of walking in the misty cloud itself is excellent.

tripreview.Title: "Go for beauty not for wildlife"
tripreview.sentence: They should change the name from National park to goat park.
Why they call it national park didnt understand.
Very good for scenic views.
They will charge 90 inr from you only to see goats.

tripreview.Title: "Heaven on earth!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Its not just a reserve park.
even a journey to the park on their bus is a great experience.
It feels like living in clouds.
It has so many rare and protected goats that it seems bliss to share their environment.
Having been to Switzerland, I would recommend this place to everybody as this place would provide great opportunities to relax.

tripreview.Title: "Best Experience Till the date....!!!!!!"
tripreview.sentence: Don't miss the chance to see such a beautiful place .
On the way to the place there is a huge water falls , Try to sit on the right side of the bus while going up.

tripreview.Title: "Very nice view and trek at the hill top"
tripreview.sentence: When we went to the hill top, we were unlucky not to see the wild goat as it was drizzling.
Still the trekking up and down at the top is very good.
We could see the steep hills and the waterfalls.

tripreview.Title: "Men cant climb such heights were goats climb"
tripreview.sentence: Persons once going munnar (kerala) should go to Rajamalai without which trip to kerala is waste.
So on mountains how roads are built and such a nature to be enjoyed and overall to enjoy natures paradise are all sorts of heaven on earth or Gods own country to be felt and feel is only in kerala.
Goats climb rocks so easily and fast where human cant even think and try.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful top of the world feeling"
tripreview.sentence: Yes the place can be visited more for the "flying" in clouds feeling (obviously post rainfalls) rather than spotting any wild life.
Which is as rare as the species itself.
The place lists atleast 5- 6 rare species, Nigiri Tahr is in total 120 spread across 97sq/km area of which you get to visit a mere 1km road stretch with 90 INR fees.
Oh for those planning, October 2018, will witness another rare 12 yearly violet flower bed blossom across the mountains.

tripreview.Title: "Nice place"
tripreview.sentence: This is one of the most popular tourist spots in Munnar.
We reached there in the morning.
Spent long time in the queue for getting tickets.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful natural beauty...But such a long wait!"
tripreview.sentence: The end result is superb!
But we had to wait in the line for 4 hours to finally get on the bus to take us to the top.
The bus ride itself is fabulous and you can hike around 1 km more after the bus ride to see even better views.
However, we saw just one Nilgiri Tahr and that too we felt was planted
haha
may be that's not fair of me
But still.
So if you really want to feel good about the whole experience, reach early
by early I mean6-7 AM and then may be you will not get a line.
PS: The boiled corn cobs and kairi and carrots that you get in the small shops are tasty and needed.

tripreview.Title: "Fantastic place to visit in Munnar"
tripreview.Userloc: National Capital Territory of Delhi, India
tripreview.sentence: The views from the top is amazing, and makes for really nice photo-shoots.
The only downside is the long queue you have to take.
We had to be in queue for ~3hrs.
If you cannot stand waiting in queue- then just skip this.
There is no VIP entry here.
But I personally felt the wait worth it.

tripreview.Title: "the one thing not worth visiting in Kerala"
tripreview.sentence: Worst experience!
entry of 225/- to see 5 goats a.k.a lion goat.
i understand they are rare but not attractive to wait in line then go by a share bus ride for 15 mins.

tripreview.Title: "Waste of time and money."
tripreview.sentence: visit of this park will take your 4-5 hour and then you will realize that it is not worth.

You need to be in long que to buy entry ticket,( around Rs 100/) and ticket for camera( Rs 38/- , if u do not have change, they will keep it Rs 40, so 2 rs per camera is their profit- Unaccounted), I suggested them to make it rs 40/- as official fee).
As you advance in your que, ticet counter will come.
Then u board their bus.
They have around 6 -8 bus which take you on top of hill by aound 10 minutes journey.
The journey to top is the main attraction, u can see a grand valley view,cloud roaming at many places,.
waterfall.
once u reach at top, then you need to walk a log distance up the hill to see some view points and some animal( which thye claim but no body saw that).
So if u have seen the Munnar valley from any place, you will not enjoy much to see the similar view by spedning 4 hour and some money.
On top there is a shop where u can buy tea and other stuff, whcih u can buy any where in Munnar.
It is good for young student and first timer who willing to walk and spent their time ,but for othere it is not worth and better to see other places in munnar to really enjoy the scenic beauty.

tripreview.Title: "Highlight of our trip"
tripreview.sentence: We were skeptical about the national park at first since we had heard about the long queues for entry.
We had to stand in queue for close to an hour, but in the end it turned out to be worth it.
From the ticket counter, a bus (park vehicle) takes you uphill into the midst of the national park.
From the drop-off point, there is another 1-2 km trek up-hill, but the views are simply spectacular - probably the best in Munnar.
Along the way, we ran into several Nilgiri Tahrs (or perhaps they ran into us) - they are not camera shy and we took numerous photographs.
Definitely a must visit!

tripreview.Title: "god excellent place"
tripreview.sentence: my feeling was superb, must visit place .
great view of mountain, and estates.
Reach the spot as early as possible or else you may have to face very long queue.
Buy ticket and get into the bus's front row.
Bus drop you in one spot close to souvenir shop.
( provided by park becoz no private vehicle allowed).
Keep good camera, binocular and pair of shoe ( oldies keep walking stick, monkey cap, water botl, umberalla.
) Whole park is very secured and monitored by CCTV.
Do not disturb animals in any form.
No plucking of flowers.
